Interface dominoes.players.DominoPlayer 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Interface dominoes.players.DominoPlayer

public interface DominoPlayer
extends Object
This is the interface which all domino players must implement.

bonesInHand()
The bones in the player's hand
draw(BoneYard)
Draw a tile from the given boneyard
getName()
Return the name of the player
getPoints()
Get the number of points the player has
makePlay(Table)
Pick a bone to play and where it should be played
newRound()
About to start a new round.
numInHand()
The number of bones the player has in its hand
setName(String)
Set the player's name
setPoints(int)
Set the number of points the player has
takeBack(Bone)
Tell the player to take back the specified bone.

makePlay 
  public abstract Play makePlay(Table table) throws CantPlayException
Pick a bone to play and where it should be played
Parameters:
table - The current table configuration so the player can select a valid bone to play
Returns:
a bone and which end of the layout to place it wrapped up in a Play object.
Throws: CantPlayException
thrown when the player has no bones to play
takeBack 
  public abstract void takeBack(Bone bone)
Tell the player to take back the specified bone. This usually happens when the player has tried to play an invalid bone.
Parameters:
bone - The bone to take back
draw 
  public abstract void draw(BoneYard boneyard)
Draw a tile from the given boneyard
Parameters:
boneyard - The boneyard from which a tile is drawn
numInHand 
  public abstract int numInHand()
The number of bones the player has in its hand
Returns:
how many bones the player has
bonesInHand 
  public abstract Bone[] bonesInHand()
The bones in the player's hand
Returns:
an array of bones that are in the player's hand
newRound 
  public abstract void newRound()
About to start a new round. Clear out the player's hand.
setPoints 
  public abstract void setPoints(int points)
Set the number of points the player has
Parameters:
points - The number of points the player has
getPoints 
  public abstract int getPoints()
Get the number of points the player has
Returns:
the number of points the player has
setName 
  public abstract void setName(String name)
Set the player's name
Parameters:
name - the name of the player
getName 
  public abstract String getName()
Return the name of the player
Returns:
the name of the player
